name: Extensor compartment I
text: Extensor compartment I (first dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: abductor pollicis longus (APL) and extensor pollicis brevis (EPB). Relationship: EPB tendon lies ulnar to APL; APL often has multiple tendon slips. Pathology: De Quervain tenosynovitis.

name: Extensor compartment II
text: Extensor compartment II (second dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: extensor carpi radialis longus (ECRL) and extensor carpi radialis brevis (ECRB). Relationship: ECRL lies radial to ECRB. Pathology: intersection syndrome (extensor tendinitis).

name: Extensor compartment III
text: Extensor compartment III (third dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: extensor pollicis longus (EPL). Relationship: tendon courses ulnar to Lister tubercle. Exam: tested by placing palm flat on table and lifting the thumb. Pathology: EPL rupture at Lister tubercle, especially after distal radius fractures; drummer’s tendinitis.

name: Extensor compartment IV
text: Extensor compartment IV (fourth dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: extensor digitorum communis (EDC) and extensor indicis proprius (EIP). Relationship: EIP lies ulnar to index EDC; EIP has most distal muscle belly; small EDC slip present in only ~25%. Sensory posterior interosseous nerve lies in compartment floor. Pathology: extensor tenosynovitis.

name: Extensor compartment V
text: Extensor compartment V (fifth dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: extensor digiti minimi (EDM). Relationship: EDM lies ulnar to small finger EDC. Pathology: tendon rupture in rheumatoid arthritis (Vaughan–Jackson syndrome).

name: Extensor compartment VI
text: Extensor compartment VI (sixth dorsal compartment of wrist). Contents: extensor carpi ulnaris (ECU). Relationship: ECU subsheath is part of the TFCC. Pathology: snapping or subluxation at the ulnar styloid.
